trans-unit.source: Exposes <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> types to UI Automation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
This <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer> remains in memory until the associated <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> is destroyed.

The same instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer> is returned from subsequent calls to this method and calls to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer.FromElement%2A>.
The type of the peer is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A> virtual callback.
If <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> does not implement the callback, no <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer> is created, and this method returns `null`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
The created <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>; or `null`, if the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> was not created by the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer.CreatePeerForElement(System.Windows.UIElement)"></xref> method.
Gets the accelerator key for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKey"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AcceleratorKey"></xref> that is returned by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetAcceleratorKey(System.Windows.DependencyObject)"></xref>.

Gets the access key for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey"></xref>.
The access key for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Gets the control type for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType.Custom"></xref> enumeration value.
Gets the string that uniquely identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId"></xref> that is returned by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetAutomationId(System.Windows.DependencyObject)"></xref>.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that represents the bounding rectangle of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that contains the coordinates of the element.

Optionally, if the element is not both a <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> and a <xref href="System.Windows.PresentationSource"></xref>, this method returns <xref href="System.Windows.Rect.Empty"></xref>.
Gets the collection of child elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren"></xref>.
A list of child <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> elements.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref> string.

Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that represents the clickable space that is on the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> on the element that allows a click.

The point values are (<xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>, <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>) if the element is not both a <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> and a <xref href="System.Windows.PresentationSource"></xref>.

Gets the string that describes the functionality of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText"></xref>.
Typically, the string that returns is the same text that the control provides in the tooltip.

The string that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.HelpText"></xref> that is returned by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetHelpText(System.Windows.DependencyObject)"></xref>.

Gets a string that communicates the visual status of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus"></xref>.
For example, the status of a messenger contact can be "Busy" or "Online".

The string that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.ItemStatus"></xref> that is returned by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetItemStatus(System.Windows.DependencyObject)"></xref>.

Gets a human-readable string that contains the item type that the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> represents.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType"></xref>.
String examples are "Mail Message", "Contact", and "Document".

The string that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.ItemType"></xref> that is returned by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetItemType(System.Windows.DependencyObject)"></xref>.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the element that is targeted to the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy"></xref>.
The element targeting the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> can be a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label>, but it does not have to be.

If it is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label>, setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label.Target%2A> property will automatically set the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.LabeledBy%2A> property as well.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the element that is targeted to the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Gets the text label of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.Name%2A> property functions similar to a string of text that users use to explain the control they are referring to.

Make certain that you have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.

The string that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.Name"></xref> that is returned by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetName(System.Windows.DependencyObject)"></xref>.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is laid out in a specific direction.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation.None"></xref> enumeration value.
Gets the control pattern for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
A value from the enumeration.
An object that implements the interface if patternInterface is ; otherwise, `null`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> currently has keyboard input focus.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.HasKeyboardFocus"></xref>.
`true` if the element has keyboard input focus; otherwise, `false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is an element that contains data that is presented to the user.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsContentElement"></xref>.
`true`.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is understood by the end user as interactive.

Optionally, the user might understand the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_gui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-gui-md.md)].
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement"></xref>.
`true`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> can accept keyboard focus.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable"></xref>.
A `boolean` that contains the value of <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.IsEnabled"></xref>.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> can accept keyboard focus.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable"></xref>.
`true` if the element is focusable by the keyboard; otherwise `false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is off the screen.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen"></xref>.
This property does not indicate whether the element is visible.
In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible.
For example, if the element is on the screen but obscured by other elements, it might not be visible.
In this case the method returns `false`.
`true` if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, `false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> contains protected content.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsPassword"></xref>.
`false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is required to be completed on a form.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsRequiredForForm"></xref>.

A `boolean` that contains the value that is returned by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetIsRequiredForForm(System.Windows.DependencyObject)"></xref>, if it's set; otherwise `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Sets the keyboard input focus on the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.SetFocus"></xref>.
